title: 'The Shining' hotel planning horror museum
text:
CNN Leadership
'The Shining' hotel ups the fear factor with plans for horror museum Updated 1325 GMT (2025 HKT) October 23, 2015 14 photos: Hotels that play a role A stay at the Stanley Hotel in Estes Park, Colorado, helped inspire Stephen King's 1977 bestseller "The Shining." Hide Caption 1 of 14 14 photos: Hotels that play a role Timberline Lodge acted as the exterior of the Overlook Hotel in the movie adaptation of "The Shining." Hide Caption 14 photos: Hotels that play a role The chilling film features Jack Nicholson as the increasingly deranged father of a clairvoyant child. Hide Caption 14 photos: Hotels that play a role San Diego's Hotel del Coronado starred as a location for 1959's "Some Like It Hot." Hide Caption 14 photos: Hotels that play a role The film, starring Marilyn Monroe, Tony Curtis and Jack Lemmon, is a beloved American comedy. Hide Caption 5 of 14 14 photos: Hotels that play a role The Hotel Alfonso XIII in Seville, Spain, is featured in the 1962 film "Lawrence of Arabia." Hide Caption 6 of 14 14 photos: Hotels that play a role "Lawrence of Arabia" tells the story of British military figure T.E. Lawrence's World War I exploits. Hide Caption 14 photos: Hotels that play a role A scene from "Argo" was filmed at the Beverly Hilton, a midcentury Beverly Hills classic. Hide Caption 8 of 14 14 photos: Hotels that play a role The Beverly Wilshire is referred to by some Los Angeles locals as the "Pretty Woman" hotel for its role in the 1990 film starring Julia Roberts and Richard Gere. Hide Caption 9 of 14 14 photos: Hotels that play a role Roberts' character, a prostitute with a big heart, wins over the hotel's staff -- and Richard Gere's character -- during her stay. Hide Caption 10 of 14 14 photos: Hotels that play a role The sleek Park Hyatt Tokyo is a quiet refuge in Tokyo's vibrant Shinjuku area for the characters in "Lost in Translation." Hide Caption 11 of 14 14 photos: Hotels that play a role Scarlett Johansson plays a lonely young photographer's wife who strikes up an unlikely friendship with a fading actor played by Bill Murray in "Lost in Translation." Hide Caption 12 of 14 14 photos: Hotels that play a role Round Hill Hotel and Villas provided the setting for "How Stella Got Her Groove Back," about a workaholic divorcee who finds love with a younger man. Hide Caption 13 of 14 14 photos: Hotels that play a role The James Bond film "On Her Majesty's Secret Service" features the Hotel Palacio in Estoril, Portugal. Hide Caption
